question.text: The electrochemical extraction of aluminium from bauxite ore involves

options.text: the reaction of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>Al</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> with coke <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mfenced></math> at a temperature <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>></mo><mn>2500</mn><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.

the neutralization of aluminate solution by passing <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> gas to precipitate hydrated alumina <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>Al</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>.</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>.

the dissolution of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>Al</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> in hot aqueous <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>NaOH</mi></math>.

the electrolysis of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>Al</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> mixed with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>Na</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>AlF</mi><mn>6</mn></msub></math> to give <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>Al</mi></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>CO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

solution.text:
(A) The reduction of Al2O3 with coke C at a temperature >2500 °C is not carried out due to the formation of carbides.

(B) It is correct as neutralisation of aluminate solution is done by passing CO2 gas to precipitate hydrated alumina.

(C) Reaction of powdered one is carried out with hot concentrated NaOH at 473 K-523 K and 35-36 bar pressure.

(D)Aluminium In the metallurgy of aluminium, purified Al2O3 is mixed with Na3AlF6 or CaF2 which lowers the melting point of the mixture and brings conductivity.Thus electrolysis of the molten mass is carried out in an electrolytic cell using carbon electrodes. The oxygen liberated at anode reacts with the carbon of anode producing CO and CO2 and Al at the cathode.
